explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Rat LD50 value =6500mg/kg (EHC 65 (1987)) ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.19 (2003), Based on PATTY (4th, 1994), Recommendation of Sanei Academy(1993), and 2200mg/kg (DFGOT vol.19 (2003)). Based on the data above, the lower value was applied to be classified to category 5.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From the description that death was not observed at 2000mg/kg in the dermal administration test using rabbits (DFGOT vol.19 (2003)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since it was described that there was no skin irritation in the test using the rabbit, and there was no report that indicated skin irritation in the example of human exposure (EHC 65 (1987), ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.19 (2003), and PATTY (4th, 1994)), it was carried out the outside of Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2A based on the description that the disorder was acknowledged in the conjunctiva, iris and cornea by the rabbit study and the symptoms did not recover in one animal on the Day 7 (DFGOT vol.19 (2003)). In addition, we found the description that it had an irritant property on the human eye by exposure to concentrated vapors (PATTY (4th, 1994), Japan Society for Occupational Health Recommendation of Occupational Exposure Limits(1993)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: We found a description that sensitizing property was not acknowledged in Maximization test with the guinea pigs in DFGOT vol.19 (2003). On the other hand, we found a description that there were a few case reports in which skin sensitization was acknowledged in human in PATTY (4th, 1994), however, we found the descriptions in ACGIH (2002) and DFGOT vol.19 (2003) that the examples which gave positive result to 2-butanol by the skin patch tests showed sensitization to primary or secondary alcohols, and it is suggested to be positive reaction by cross sensitization, therefore we could not conclude that 2-butanol itself has a skin sensitizing property. We could not classify it.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There are no mutagenicity and genotoxicity study data in the in vivo, and all were negative in the in vitro mutagenicity test. So it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the two-generation reproduction study by the drinking water medication in rat of ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.19 (2003), and the PATTY (4th, 1994), there is no effect on reproductive potential, only the minimum influence (growth retardation of a pup) was observed. On the other hand, based on the description that reduction of live newborns and increase of embryo absorption were observed at the dose in which dam toxicity is observed in the test which carried out inhalation exposure in the gestational age of the rat. So it was considered as Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.19 (2003), PATTY (4th, 1994), and Society for Occupational Health Recommendation of Occupational Exposure that nasal and throat are stimulated in humans in high exposure levels, it is thought that there is respiratory irritant. And anesthetic actions is seen in humans and mice according to EHC 65 (1987), and in rats and mice inhalation exposure according to DFGOT vol.19 (2003) and PATTY (4th, 1994). Both were set as Category 3. Moreover, although central nervous system depression symptoms were seen in mice described in high inhalation exposure levels (DFGOT vol.19 (2003)) , it was judged as anesthesia action at high-concentration.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 24-hour EC50=2300mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EHC65, 1987).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.81*105mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
